wikipedia_page.main: Susanna Duncombe  (née Highmore; 5 December 1725 – 28 October 1812) was an English poet and artist.

response: *October 28 – Susanna Duncombe, English poet and painter (born 1725)
*December 5 – Susanna Duncombe, English poet and artist (died 1812)
* Susanna Duncombe (1725–1812), English poet and artist
* 28 October – Susanna Duncombe, poet and painter (born 1725)

He studied at Corpus Christi College, Cambridge, where he became a fellow. He contributed to the Gentleman's Magazine under the pseudonym Crito, was a well-known poet, and wrote in 1754 a celebration of British women poets, the Feminead. He was married to the poet Susanna Duncombe.
* December 5 – Susanna Duncombe (died 1812), English poet and artist

In 1771 Dr. Berkeley became prebendary of Canterbury, and they then went to reside at The Oaks, the area at Canterbury Cathedral which had once been the monastery garden. Eliza, supported by her friend Susanna Duncombe, became a dominant figure in the group of wives of the chapter.
